result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian Michael Tollifson

records.addlTxt: Filed by victim, regarding no contact order. C: VW, DA, and DE Atty. olg    Per SRN on 10/27/2022 - Victim should reach out to Turning Point

8:35 AM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Brian Michael Tollifson in court, in custody.  Attorney Abrianna Dolfi for Atty Schmidt in court for Brian Michael Tollifson.  Prosecuting attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CM542 & 22FO478. Court reviews files and notes DE is on probation hold and reviews bond.  ADA Becker states ADA Damrau sent an offer a few weeks ago but doesn't know the status of that at this time.  Atty Dolfi states DE does know about the offer but believes another PTC date would be acceptable.
Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for December 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial/scheduling conference on December 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

AMENDED 

WHEN Defendants probation agent has secured a bed at an inpatient treatment facility, this bond will be converted to a $750 signature bond, without necessity of hearing. If Defendant is discharged from the treatment facility without staff approval, Defendant is to report to the St. Croix County Jail immediately. 

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, K. Rivard.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant. 

Defendant may retrieve personal belongings from the residence in the presence of law enforcement ONLY. 

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

10:20 AM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Brian Michael Tollifson in court, in custody.  Attorney Stephanie Kay Schmidt in court for Brian Michael Tollifson.  Prosecuting attorney Aaron M. Damrau in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews file and notes bond modification request. Bond argument by parties. Court modifies bond to signature bond ONCE Probation Agent has secured a bed at an inpatient treatment program without necessity of a hearing, until then bond continues in form and amount. DE can appear by zoom for next hearing if in treatment. Adjourned at 10:31 AM. bph
Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial/scheduling conference on October 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
for Release/Modification/ Change in Sentence, filed by DE.  Per SRN on 9/15/22- Check with DE's Atty, schedule hearing if necessary.  JA scheduled hearing. bph
Bail/bond hearing on September 20, 2022 at 10:15 am.

1:37 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Brian Michael Tollifson in court, in custody.  Attorney Stephanie Kay Schmidt in court for Brian Michael Tollifson.  Prosecuting attorney Holly Elkin Rockow in court for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CM542 & 22FO478. DE qualifies for PD and updates address. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG on both CM and FO case.  Court sets bond and next hearing. Adjourned at 1:41 PM. bph
